content: I think I'll look into the middle ground, something that offers a balance between grip and durability. I don't plan on tracking my car every weekend, but I do want to have some fun on the track occasionally. I'll check out some reviews and see what other drivers with similar goals have to say about different tire options. By the way, do you know if I need to worry about any specific regulations or requirements for tires at the Speed Demon Racing Track in Pleasanton, California?
